description.p: You can make a Hermeticist quickly by following these suggestions. First, make your spellcasting ability your highest ability score. Second, choose the sage background.
As a hermeticist, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per hermeticist level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Arcana, Athletics, History, Insight, Investigation, and Perception.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a scholar’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

sheet.description: A magic user who can freely cast magic that don't challenge the established limits of Hermetic Theory.

setters.set: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality.

multiclass.prerequisite: Constitution 13 and Intelligence 13, Wisdom 13, or Charisma 13

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you have attained the ability to manipulate the raw energies of the world, so long as you operate under a set of rules. To create spells you can combine different Techniques and Forms to achieve different effects. Casting without preparation is possible but much more difficult.

In order to successfully cast a spell after determining its Technique, Form, and Magnitude, a successful Hermetic Check must be made. A Hermetic check is equal to (DC of the Spell / Spell Level) + Fatigue Modifier. Forms of advantage and disadvantage, or other modifiers do not apply to this check.

center.p: Hermetic check DC = (DC of the Spell/ Spell Level) + Fatigue Modifier

description.p: Fatigue is gained upon failing a Hermetic Check, as the failed spell backfires. The total number of Fatigue levels impose a penalty: -0 at 1 (Winded), -1 at 2 (Weary), -3 at 3 (Tired), and -5 at 4 (Dazed). At 5 levels, you fall unconscious. Fatigue can be cleared by resting, with short rests removing 1 level of fatigue and Long rests removing 3 levels.

The Hermeticism table shows your Spell Level, which increases as you level allowing you to cast more powerful spells of which you are trained in. Casting more than one spell per round treats the additional spells as a rushed spell, halving its spell level by 2 rounded up, and you can only cast one spell with a magnitude component per turn.
Your spellcasting ability is determined by your hermetic gift. See the Gift feature of your hermetic gift for your spellcasting ability.

Some spell effects do not remain permanent upon being cast. Using Creo to heal a wound will only suppress the effects until the duration ends, never truly healing it. In order to bypass this limit, a ritual cast must take place, consuming raw magical energy, vis, in the process.
To produce vis, the caster must spend a day’s worth of downtime pouring magical energy into a medium of one of the forms.
You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your hermeticist spells.

sheet.description: You have learned to alter reality through ancient tomes. You use an arcane focus to cast spells. and can also cast madnomancer spells as a ritual.

description.p: Choose a Hermetic Gift, which describes how your gift manifests. Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.
Starting at 2nd level, you gain proficiency in two Hermetic Techniques and Forms.
When you gain certain Hermeticism levels you gain additional techniques and forms of your choice. Trained techniques and forms create more efficient spells that utilize them.

Proficiency with a technique allows you to divide the DC determining a successful cast of a spell which utilizes the technique by your spell level. Proficiency with a form allows you to add your proficiency bonus and spellcasting ability modifier to the DC determining a successful cast of a spell which utilizes the form.

Additionally, you can modify existing spells with additional techniques and forms you are trained in to cast a complex spell. Complex spells only retain their proficiency bonuses if all techniques and forms are trained.

Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to create small fragments of Vis, which can temporarily store magic inside them. When you cast a spell, you can condense the spell’s energy into a fragment of vis embodying the form used to create it.

A creature holding this fragment can use its action to release the spell within, whereupon the fragment disappears. The spell uses your attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes.

Once you create a bead with this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Attempting to create a second bead will destroy the first, vanishing in a flash of light, losing the spell.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

At 18th level, you have learned how to partially bypass the limits of Hermetic Theory. You no longer need to cast spells at a ritual level for them to have a permanent effect. Demons can no longer fool your Intellego Techniques. Additionally you can change the properties of raw vis, allowing it to be transferred between different forms.

description.p: At 20th level, you are no longer bound by lesser limits, and have ascended to the divine state.
You have successfully halted the process of aging.
You gain immunity to radiant damage, and are considered a celestial.

You learn how to create a powerful aspect of time, in which you can store your current state in a mote of temporal energy. This mote is a Tiny object with AC 15 and 1 hit point, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage.
If you die, so long as your mote has not been destroyed, you are restored to your condition at the time you created the mote, destroying the mote in the process.
Your mote takes one week to collect temporal energy before it can be used again.

description.p: Your magic comes from exposure to ancient technology, and from it you gained the ability to understand the structure of any non living construct. With a profound understanding of the laws of creation, and the ability to analyze the composition of matter, you are second to none when it comes to understanding advanced mechanizations and designs.
Starting at first level the size of your spell’s AoE is doubled as you are adept at creating in the midst of battle.

Additionally, you have a sense for anything that occurs within this terrain during its duration, you can cast spells on anyone within a terrain you have created as if you were touching them, ignoring range requirements.

sheet.description: The size of your spell’s AoE is doubled. Additionally, you have a sense for anything that occurs within this terrain during its duration, you can cast spells on anyone within a terrain you have created as if you were touching them, ignoring range requirements.

description.p: At 6th level, you can freely manipulate your terrain without having to maintain concentration on it. Manipulating it in this way is not enough to directly cause harm, but it can be used to allow passage ways to shift or other alterations.
Additionally certain properties of the existing terrain can be adjusted so long as you are proficient in the form used in the process. Ex.( Can cause flame to freeze over with an Aquam requisite).

Vis created to house this ability is shaped in the same form of your terrain. While possessing this mote, the wielder is aware of everyone inside the terrain, even if they can’t see them. They can also create small alterations in the terrain, enough to change certain passageways.

description.p: At 10th level, terrain you create lasts one level of duration longer, and allows you to continue adjusting it should you fall unconscious.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, if terrain is cast using the range of self, enemies trapped inside are restricted from leaving until they kill you or you end the spell.
Additionally, casting from self renders you and any you choose immune to any negative effects of the terrain, and gives you the benefits of half cover.

description.p: You were not gifted with the capabilities of external creation, and instead have developed a sharp affinity to magic that enhances or changes your natural electrical current.

You cannot cast spells with a range greater than self. You gain proficiency with Auram; if you would already gain proficiency from your trained forms, you gain expertise instead. You are innately acute to the effects of Muto, and learn it. If you would already have learned this technique from your trained forms, spells cast using it are treated as one spell level higher.

You gain a resource called charge. Charge is refreshed at the start of each of your turns, and is equal to your Spell Level. Your charge grants you an unarmored defense of 10 + Intelligence modifier + Charge Level. You can use your charge in a number of different ways to enhance your body's natural capabilities.
You can teleport up to 10 feet per charge expended, as your body moves with the blessing of Auram.

You manifest a spear of electricity in your hand that does (Spell Level)d4 + Intelligence electricity damage. This is a thrown weapon attack with a range of (60/240). You can overcharge this spear by consuming charges, increasing the size of the die up to a d12. If you overcharge it past a d12, you can teleport to the point of impact.

You directly channel the current into your fists, striking foes at breakneck speeds. You have a charge die that increases as you gain levels in this class. Unarmed strikes do charge die + Intelligence Modifier Electricity or Thunder damage. You can consume charges to make 1 additional attack per charge expended after attacking with an unarmed strike or teleporting by any means.

description.p: At 6th level, whenever you get hit by an attack you gain a temporary level of overcharge. Overcharge is treated the same way as charge is, but is lost at the end of your next turn if not used.

Additionally, your charged agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon’s lightning breath or a fireball spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

description.p: Also at 6th level, you learn to manifest your Hermetic Bestowal feature into a pill of pure electricity. Unlike the regular uses of this feature however, others can not make use of this pill, and in fact take lightning damage equal to (Spell Level) x (Charge Die) upon trying to do so. Consuming this pill confers a number of benefits, but is terribly taxing on the user.

After consuming it, you can use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Dexterity Modifier for all rolls involving it. You gain resistance to lightning damage; if you would already gain this resistance from a different feature, it instead turns into immunity. You can teleport up to half your movement without expending any charge, and you gain one level of Overcharge at the start of each of your turns.

This transformation lasts until it is dismissed, and has varying levels of fatigue drain depending on the time spent in it. 1 minute: 1 fatigue. 1 hour: 2 fatigue. 8 hours: 3 fatigue. These fatigue levels are cumulative, and are suffered once the body passes the threshold, or when the effect ends.

Additionally, whenever your health hits 0, you can instead have it hit 1 as you resuscitate yourself back to awareness for 1 level of fatigue.
Additionally, you recover twice as much from the effects of fatigue and exhaustion whenever you take a short or long rest.

description.p: At 14th level your body is tempered to the point where you can temporarily consume all the charge in your body for a heavy price. Once per long rest, you can consume two lightning pills at once, entering a state of Godspeed. In Godspeed, you can teleport up to your movement speed without expending any charge, and gain two levels of Overcharge at the start of each of your turns. Whenever you take advantage of the resurrection aspect of Lethal Voltage, you instead gain one level of exhaustion, and can temporarily ignore the effects of exhaustion. This state lasts for 1 minute, and you suffer 5 levels of fatigue upon exiting, and suffer the effects of exhaustion you accumulated.

description.p: Your magic comes from a curse, the more you draw it the more crystals will consume your core, the origin of your magic and self. These crystals can be harnessed and contained through effort, but make no doubt that one day they will kill you. Starting at first level, whenever you successfully cast a spell you gain one charge of corruption. Your maximum level of corruption is equivalent to your charisma modifier (Minimum of 1). Corruption reduces you max health by 1, but is added to your Hermetic Check DC for each charge.

Additionally you have the option to cleanse this corruption by releasing it all in a powerful burst of magic. By sacrificing your corruption, you can increase the magnitude of your spells damage die by 1 per corruption charge, up to a d12. If the charges of corruption are used on a d12, instead of increasing its magnitude the spell will crit on a natural roll of 19-20, and heal you for half of damage dealt. Lost max health from corruption is restored by a short or long rest.

description.p: Starting at level 6, you can surrender part of your core to the corruption to enter a hyper state, drawing out more power from your curse but putting your life at risk. While in this state, your corruption increases by 1 at the start of every turn. Attacks that overcharge a d12 crit on a natural roll of 18-20, and add your spell modifier to your damage rolls, but no longer heal you. Additionally, if your max health is reduced to less than half its normal value, it becomes much more difficult to cleanse your blight: Short rests no longer restore max health. You receive one level of fatigue upon exiting this form.

All other effects of corruption and partial demonization apply to the user. Creating the Vis required for this feature applies one level of fatigue to the caster, and one level of exhaustion to anyone who uses the magic upon exiting as their body is not naturally compatible.

description.p: Starting at level 14, frequent exposure to your blight has enabled you to enter a temporary state of full demonization. Once per long rest you can fully demonize for 1 minute. In a full demonization state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your corruption increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped. Attacks that overcharge a d12 crit on a natural roll of 17-20, and add your spell modifier to your damage rolls, but no longer heal you. You cannot cleanse corruption until you exit this state, and you suffer two levels of fatigue upon doing so. After killing an enemy, drain heals you for an amount equal to your current corruption + your proficiency bonus. If your max health falls below half its maximum, make a DC 10 wisdom save. On a failure you immediately attack whoever is nearest to you.

Additionally, when a target other than yourself receives the benefits of an overcharged d12, they instead gain one turn of haste. Doubling their movement speed and giving them one additional attack action.

description.p: Starting at level 14, frequent exposure to your angelic nature has enabled you to enter a temporary state of full angelification. Once per long rest you can fully angelificate for 1 minute. In a full angelification state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your purity increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped. Spells that overcharge a d12 crit on a natural roll of 18-20, and add your spell modifier to your rolls, but no longer heal you. You suffer two levels of fatigue upon exiting this state.

description.p: You were not gifted with the capabilities of creation, and instead have developed a sharp affinity to the magic residing inside yourself and surrounding others.
Creo spells are twice as expensive to manifest. You gain proficiency with Vim, if you would already gain proficiency from your trained forms, you gain expertise instead.

Additionally, your body is filled with and strengthened by Vis. You may add your spell level to your hp every time you gain a level in this class. Spells cast from a range of touch are considered unarmed strikes and add your wisdom modifier to their damage rolls.

Additionally a creature holding your mote can choose to expend it in reaction to being attacked. Causing it to form a barrier that will fully absorb the incoming damage.

description.p: At 10th level you gain the ability to manipulate the Vis in the body of another more easily. As a reaction you can stop the Vis flowing through an enemies body within touch range for a short period, freezing them in place and stunning them until the end of their turn. Doing this takes a toll on your body and gives +1 fatigue.
Additionally, spells cast on an enemy within touch range no longer suffer the improvised penalty.

description.p: At 14th level your body is perfectly enhanced by the Vis you have mastered. You can no longer be damaged by spells lower than half your spell level rounded up. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and magic effects.
Additionally, you can cast touch spells from a range of 30ft, and spells that are cast on a range of self are treated as one spell level higher.

description.p: You have been gifted with an awareness of your soul. Through this awareness you have learned to shape it and use it as a tool against others.

As an action you can manifest a soul weapon. This weapon can take the form of any weapon you are proficient with, and does an amount of damage equal to you spell level times your soul weapon die. Your soul weapon die starts at a d4, and increases as you gain levels in the class. You use your wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls used for this weapon.

Additionally as a bonus action while you have a manifested soul weapon, you can choose to infuse your attack with the power of your magic. The next time you attack with your soul weapon you can cast a spell from it instead of yourself. Spells cast this way have a casting time of 1 Action and a Range of Self.

sheet.description: You can manifest a soul weapon. This weapon can take the form of any weapon you are proficient with. Your soul weapon does 1d{{soul weapon:die}} damage. You use your wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls used for this weapon. Additionally as a bonus action while you have a manifested soul weapon, you can choose to infuse your attack with the power of your magic. The next time you attack with your soul weapon you can cast a spell from it instead of yourself. Spells cast this way have a casting time of 1 Action and a Range of Self.

description.p: At 6th level, once per long rest you can partially manifest your soul into a protective aura surrounding you for one hour. Attacks made with your soul weapon are made from the aura, leaving your hands free. If a creature approaches within 5 feet of you while it is manifested you may make an attack of opportunity.

Additionally, any ranged attacks against you have disadvantage as the aura automatically moves to deflect the blow. Should it land you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1 soul weapon die + your Hermeticist level. Additional uses of this feature cost +1 fatigue to maintain.

You can gift your projection feature to a creature once per long rest, with additional motes costing +2 fatigue to create. Any creature holding a mote made from this receives the benefits of the aura.
Additionally you may make attacks with your soul weapon from your mote's position.

description.p: At 10th level you can turn an enemy against themself. As an action you can cause an enemy within 30ft to manifest their soul. Their soul is only visible to them, and cannot be killed. A creature with a manifested soul will only focus on attacking it, and at the start of each of their turns their soul will deal 1 soul weapon die damage to them. To end the effect, they can either die, or succeed on a wisdom saving throw against your spell save dc at the start of their turn. A creature who succeeds their saving throw cannot be affected by this again for 24 hours.

description.p: At 14th level, you can fully manifest your soul into being. Once per long rest you can create a projection of yourself through soul. It can act independently of you, and takes its turn after you on initiative count. It’s health is equal to half that of yours upon casting, and it retains all features you would normally possess. It’s spell level is considered to be half that of your spell level rounded up.

Additionally, as a reaction to being attacked you can switch places with your projection. Your projection lasts until it is destroyed or until you use this feature again. It cannot be healed and additional attempts to summon it cost +3 fatigue to maintain.

Your spell casting modifier, called Essence, is equal to the sum of your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers.

When casting a Muto conjuration spell with a range of self, you retain your mental stats in the form of what you transform into. While transformed, you can cast spells with your Hermetic Magic feature and use class features still, but must abide by the Verbal, Somatic and Material capabilities of your new form.
Additionally, you gain access to different combinations of creature types as you train yourself in more forms.

If you possess this Essence and are not transformed, but have conjured creatures, all the creatures add their HP and yours into a shared pool. If the shared pool reaches zero, the Essence is destroyed.

description.p: At 14th level your body has adapted to the forms you have used, and you have seen a way to go further beyond your limits. You can add levels of fatigue to the CR on the table to increase the CR of the spell. A CR 1 summon with 1 level of fatigue would summon a CR 2 creature for the cost of a CR 1. A CR 8 summon with 2 levels of fatigue would summon a CR 10 creature for the cost of a CR 8. If you use 5 levels of fatigue to transform, you transform as usual, but when the transformation ends you immediately fall unconscious.

description.p: You were gifted with a fragment of the Zenith Crown from Jörmex, and have fused with it, unlocking your hermetic capabilities while putting your body under constant strain. You have learned how to manifest this crown into a number of different forms. You learn different forms as you gain levels in this class, and each form confers a number of different benefits. You can only awaken one form at a time.
Your spell casting modifier, called Apex Energy, is equal to the sum of your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers.

You shape the crown into a brace around one of your arms. This crown counts as a melee weapon in which you are proficient, does damage equal to your spell level d10, and lets you use your spellcasting ability modifier for strength ability checks and saving throws. As a bonus action, you can activate the inherent gravitational energy in the crown jewel, awakening it. While awakened, you can alter the gravity of your body and the space around you. When you make an attack with your Awakened Zenith Brace, you reinforce the blow with an immeasurable heaviness on impact. Your movement speed is halved, and your attacks create a gravitational tether on hit. While a creature is tethered, if you make a weapon attack with the Awakened Zenith Bracelet, the creature is pulled in towards your strike. For every 10 ft they are moved this way, your attack does one extra die of damage. Additionally, if you have the enemy tethered and they are within your standard melee range, striking them creates a gravitational fold, imploding and sending them flying 10ft times your proficiency bonus, destroying the tether in the process. This void implosive attack doubles the damage, but your body also gains one level of fatigue in shock.

This disc counts as a thrown melee weapon in which you are proficient, does damage equal to 1d8, and doubles your movement speed. As a bonus action, you can awaken the disc. When you make an attack with your Awakened Zenith Disc, you can choose to have it create a singularity on impact, compressing everything around it. If a creature is within 5ft of the singularity, it must make a strength saving throw against your spell save dc to avoid being pulled into the singularity. On a failure, it is sucked in and takes spell level d12 force damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On success, it takes half damage and is not stunned. Creatures within 30ft of the singularity have their movement halved during its effect as it causes extreme gravity. The singularity lasts until the end of your next turn. Using this feature puts strain on your body and you gain one level of fatigue.

description.p: At 10th level, you manifest a crown medallion across your neck. As a bonus action, you can awaken the medallion. An Awakened Zenith Medallion produces a strong gravitational field around the wearer. Provided you are not wearing armor, the field produces a strong enough repulsion to add your Spell casting ability modifier to your Armor Class. As a reaction to being hit by an attack, you can instead reflect the blow back at the attacker for 1 level of fatigue.

Additionally, AoE spells cast through your Hermetic Spellcasting feature have the ability to imbue the terrain with gravitational anomalies. Flying creatures inside these anomalies have their flight disabled and fall down to the ground. All attacks and strength or dexterity saving throws within an anomaly are made with disadvantage. While the Zenith Medallion is awakened, you do not suffer the negative effects of these zones.

description.p: At 14th level you learn to summon the true form of your crown fragment in times of need. You manifest a crown atop your head. As a reaction to being reduced to 0 hit points, you awaken your crown and gain immunity to all forms of damage. While you are immune in this way, your crown becomes vulnerable to attack. It shares your AC and is immune to all conditions. Your crown has hit points equal to your level, and temp HP equal to half your max HP. Your crown remains awakened until this temp HP is exhausted, or it is destroyed. While your crown is awakened, all of your crown jewelry gains its awakened benefits. Your crown actions are all made with advantage, and you are always under the effects of haste. Your crown recharges from being destroyed after a long rest. If you are reduced to 0 HP before you reform your crown, you make 1 death save. On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point and are immune until the start of your next turn. On a failure, you are obliterated, and all memories of your existence removed from the mind of everyone. There is no way to revert this obliteration, and your Zenith Crown fragment returns to the crown.

description.p: You were gifted with the damning power of blight, a strong maddening magic source represented by tar and blackness. This gift is slowly driving you mad, but infuses you with an unreal power. Do not be consumed by this power, as overuse will surely spell your doom.
Your spell casting modifier, called Blight, is equal to the sum of your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers.

You add your spell level to your HP as your body is toughened by your sickening gift. You lose access to the standard spellcasting of Hermeticist while you are not channeling. In order to channel your gift, you must take an action to wrestle the blight into your control, filling you with a fiendish vigor as you embrace its taint. While you are channeling this blight, spellcasters can detect a sickly aura around you, and immediately are made aware of your nature. Most people are hostile to or afraid of those they know with Blight. Once you connect to the blight, make a madness check. The DC is equal to 10 + your tier of madness, and you add your spellcasting modifier to the roll. Tiers of madness are detailed at the end of the subclass description.

When channeling, your spell potency is no longer determined by a d20 roll. Instead, your spells are cast with an assumed potency of 10 + Spellcasting Modifier, and proficiencies are applied as normal. You can choose to cast spells with a potency of 20 + Spellcasting Modifier, but must make a Madness Check upon doing so. You can add your spellcasting modifier to spell damage rolls.

When you stop channeling the blight, your fatigue increases by 1. You ignore the effects of fatigue while channeling, but its negative effects are applied to all rolls when not. Channeling requires one Madness check for every additional hour it is active.

description.p: At 6th level, you can push past your limits to overchannel the blight into your spells. Once per turn, whenever you cast a spell, you can choose to increase its spell level by up to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). In order to successfully cast the spell, you must make an Overweave check to determine its effects. Increasing by one level has a DC of 15, two levels a DC of 18, three levels a DC of 22.

If you fail the check, make a constitution saving throw of equal DC. On a failure, you suffer a side effect determined by how badly the check failed. On a nat 1 on the con save, the severity increases by 1. On a miss of 1-4, you have severe headaches and gain 1 level of fatigue. On a miss of 5-8, you take 1d6 damage and gain 2 levels of fatigue. On a miss of 9-12, you take 2d6 damage and gain 3 levels of fatigue. These levels of fatigue require one day of rest before they disappear. On a miss of 13-15, you take 3d6 damage and gain 4 levels of fatigue. These levels of fatigue require two days of rest before they disappear. On a miss of 16-19, you take 4d6 damage and gain 5 levels of fatigue. You cannot channel the blight for two weeks. On a miss of 20+, you can no longer channel the blight. This can only be cured by a wish spell.

description.p: Also at 6th level, you learn to manifest your Hermetic Bestowal feature into a gate of spacetime. This gate is represented by a runed lettering, and can only be activated by those you reveal the workings to. A gate has no functionality by itself, but when two gates are present you can open up a rift that allows you to travel between them. In this rift, light is suppressed and you can never truly relax. The road is made of a cold dilapidated concrete connected by bridges suspended over immeasurably deep chasms. Travelling through it reduces the magnitude of time between the destinations by 1. A distance that would normally take a year, only takes one month. One month, a week. One week, a day. One day, an hour. One hour, a minute. One minute, one second. Etc. You can only have a number of gates up to your proficiency bonus, and can only disable them by destroying them from the inside or outside of the rift.

This feature can also be used to enter your Rift from anywhere else besides a gate, although you cannot take others with you as you normally would.

description.p: When you create a Maniac Hermeticist, you gain a resource called Sanity that decreases as your connection with the blight strengthens, eating away at your mind. Your starting Sanity is equal to 80 + 1d20. Your madness decreases by 1d6 everytime you gain a level in this class. If you fail a madness check, your fatigue increases by 1. If you fall unconscious due to building fatigue through this method, your Sanity decreases by 1d6.

You are in control of your own thoughts. You may begin to hear whispers the closer you get to 80. The voice behind these whispers has a personality that is up to your DM, but has long since fallen to Madness.
You become unsettled. Make a Madness check whenever your hit points falls below half your hit point maximum.
You have begun to laugh. Lots. Make a Madness check whenever you make a Wisdom saving throw.
At your DMs discretion, you sometimes speak with the voice of another. Seizing the blight both thrills and terrifies you. Make a Madness check whenever you stop channeling the blight.

Your mind is all but lost to you. Any stressful situation might drive you to extreme behavior. In addition to being fatigued, whenever you fail a Madness check, roll a d100. On a roll of 10 or below, your body becomes temporarily possessed by the voice in your head. The DM determines how this voice acts. You can make a Madness check contested by the Madness check of your voice to regain possession of your body. You do not suffer the negative effects of failing a madness check, although you do not gain back control. A greater restoration spell can also be used to regain control of your body.

You are so far gone with Madness, it becomes a permanent condition. You automatically fail all Madness Checks, and you are irredeemably insane. If you lose your body due to failing the percentile roll, you can only gain it back by the effects of a Greater Restoration spell.

description.p: Animal affects "all natural living things that are not plants or humans, doing to animals what Mentem and Corpus spells do to people" as well as "things made with animal products" such as leather, wool, cheese, silk, etc. Since bacteria were unknown in medieval times, illness (e.g.) was considered either a form of possession or an imbalance of 'bodily humors'; thus, magic dealing with disease is relegated variously to Creo, Mentem and/or Vim effects.
